intro: Dicerandra frutescens subsp. frutescens, commonly known as the Florida rainweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is notable for its medicinal uses by indigenous peoples, who have traditionally used it for its purported healing properties.
